DOC.brief_summary: It has been shown in the adult literature that smoking is related to depression and visa versa. Not much is known about how this relationship is started or if one perhaps leads to the other. We are performing 1 hour long interviews with adolescents ages 12-19 who meet criteria for major depression and who smoke. They are interviewed along with their parent. Questions center around their view of depression and their history of depression as well as questions around their smoking as well as the interrelationships between the two. Transcripts are made of the interview and are being analyzed for themes.
DOC.brief_title: TRIAD Project: Qualitative Study of Adolescent Depression and Smoking
DOC.criteria: 1219 years old Major depression Smoke cigarettes Lives with parents No confidentiality issues related to smoking Non English speaking Suicidal ideation Pregnant
